segments.text: I notice the boy stretching as far as he can to reach those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s standing on his tiptoes, and that stool is so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, her hand outstretched, like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how focused they both are on getting those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, drying dishes, and she has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing out of the sink, and she’s standing in it like it’s nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will get away with it or if she’ll turn around and catch them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a snapshot of childhood mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost want to laugh, but I’m also worried someone’s going to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall off that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR
